question: Which state government has recently constituted two committees to deal with a possible influx of illegal immigrants?
explanation: Following the publication of the final draft of National Register of Citizens (NRC) in Assam, the Manipur government has constituted two committees -  state and district level - to deal with a possible influx of illegal immigrants. The State Level Monitoring Committee will monitor the entry or presence of illegal immigrants in the state and take steps for creating adequate public awareness to counter the situation. It will be headed by Special Secretary (Home) while the Deputy Commissioners and Superintendents of Police as its members. The district level committee will be headed by the concerned deputy commissioners while Superintendent of Police, SDOs, SDPO, SDCs, OCs will be the members. The committee with local bodies would likely to conduct headcounts if needed.
